title: Business Process Tracking Alert Notifications
description: The Business Process Tracking Alerts template allows you to detect Business Process Tracking stages that have failed so that you can notify key business stakeholders using Microsoft Teams.
prerequisites: To use this template, you should have an existing Business Process deployed that is emitting data to an Azure Data Explorer (ADX) instance. This workflow will query a defined ADX instance and issue queries against that database and subsequently surface the business process details. To learn more about Busness Process Tracking, please see our documentation. [Learn more] (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/business-process-tracking/create-business-process) You will also need an Azure Storage Account that includes a table, with the name of your choice, that includes a field called 'LastAlertedProcessed'
detailsDescription: This template is built upon AI building blocks in Logic Apps such as Azure OpenAI connector, Azure AI Search connector, and more. The template also uses built in actions to document parsing and chunking. [Learn more] (https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/logic-apps/connectors/azure-ai)

parameters.name: Azure-TableName_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The name of the table that will be used to store the workflow last run timestamp.

parameters.name: Kusto-DBName_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The name of the database that is used to store Business Process Tracking transactions.

parameters.name: Kusto-TableName_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The name of the table that is used to store Business Process Tracking transactions. Ex. ["CityPowerAndLight-TroubleTicketProcessing"]

parameters.name: Teams-Recipient_#workflowname#
parameters.description: The email address of the person or distribution list that should receive Microsoft Teams notification.

parameters.name: kusto-ConnectionRuntimeUrl_#workflowname#
parameters.displayName: Kusto Connection Runtime URL for Business Process Tracking instance
parameters.description: The URL found on the overview page for your ADX instance in the URI field.
